moves.1. e4 c6:
Hi everyone!

I am just annotating this game on behalf of Brigadecommander (Janet) and Pitroque.  Pitroque lost this game and I am just playing through how it happened.  I will now talk you through the Caro-Kann Defense.
moves.2. d4 d5: 2. ..... d5 - as with the French Defense (e6) black's second move is almost always d5.
moves.3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5 5. Ng3: 5. Ng3 - Pitroque chooses to retreat his knight and attack the f5 bishop, but would a developing move such as e3 been better?
moves.5... Bg6 6. h4 h6: 6. ..... h6 - Janet creates a flight square for her bishop so that it can bear down on the h7-b1 diagonal.
moves.7. Nf3 Nf6 8. Ne5: 8. Ne5 - not too sure about this - I think white may have again been better served to play Be3, a developing move and to neutralise the power of Janet's light square bishop.
moves.9... Bxd3 10. Qxd3: 10. Qxd3 - and now the bishops are traded off and the WQ is on a pretty good diagonal.
moves.10... Nbd7 11. f4: 11. f4 - white wants to support his knight on e5.
moves.11... e6 12. Bd2: 12. Bd2 - development and clearing the decks for castling either side.
moves.12... Be7 13. O-O-O O-O: 13. ..... 0-0 - as with the Myevilluck/Klauno game, both sides elect to castle on opposite wings.  We shall see who wins the race here.
moves.14. Qf3 Qc7 15. Rhe1: 15. Rhe1 - giving further support to that steed on e5.
moves.15... Nd5: 15. .... Nd5 - suddenly, activity in the black camp!
moves.17... Nxe5 18. Qxh4 Nc4 19. Bxh6 gxh6 20: 20. Qxh6 - here it all goes wrong because Pitroque has unfortunately left his g3 knight en prise to the BQ.  Worse, the BQ now controls the h column, preventing Pitroque from getting at least a draw by Perpetual Check.
moves.20... Qxg3 21. Kb1 Nce3: 21. ..... Nce3 - drums beat!  In come the black cavalry and white's rook on d1 is en prise.
moves.22. f6: 22. f6 - maybe Rh1 was better, at least it would have put Janet in Old Matey's shadow!
moves.22... Qg6 23. Qh4 Qxc2+: 23. ..... Qxc2+ ..... aargh and double aaargh for white, his rook on d1 is a gonner.
moves.24. Ka1 Nxd1 25. Qg4+ Qg6 26. Qxd1 Rfd8: 26. .... Rfd8 - white's attack has run out of steam and not only that, has an 8 point material deficit to contend with against such a strong Master as Janet.  White therefore gracefully resigns on the grounds of Ruinous Loss of Material.  Commiserations and good effort here, Pitroque - you got her worried!  Kind regards - Joanne

gameName: A strong attack from Pitroque, but alas, not quite strong enough!
